title: The tribunal system needs to be improved. There are too many ways around it. Examples given.
body:
So it's rather well known that the tribunal has always had flaws, but it's at the point where it makes me want to not play the game anymore, period. I have a log from a lobby chat in ranked. I joined 3 lobbies with the same player. 

_________ : If I die in lane I'm going to quit
_________ : If you don't like it you can f off this is Silver get used to it idiots
_________  : thats awesome
_________  : You again
_________ : yep dodge or lose
_________ : your choice
_________ : Why can't I report you right now?
_________ : Come on Rito
_________  : League :D
_________  : In game I am innocent
_________ : Cant do shit about it pregame (****)ers 
_________ : guess ima play nidalee and i suck at her
_________ : cool
_________ : I'm leaving mid game anyway
_________ : nice
_________ : yep

(I starred the cursing so I can post this, and I got rid of irrelevant names for privacy)

This guy had those first two lines copy pasted in all of the three lobbies I was in with him. He didn't respond to reason, and because of the tribunal system, he will probably never be banned. I wanted to play it out too, just so we could lose and I could paste this log into a report box. This is ridiculous. People do things like this all the time, and the tribunal doesn't punish them for it. Riot needs a simple system where you can report someone by clicking on there name or something similar to that. How challenging would that be? Have you paste logs in the report, and it's all done. That way when people are passively toxic in game, or just intentionally ruining the game before it's started like this, there's a way to catch and ban these players. RIot's report system is so over complicated, and ineffective that these types of players are practically immune as long as they don't do anything in game, or say anything to warrant a ban. I want to know what people think of this, because in almost every other game, you can report someone at any given time, and riot has chosen to force you to play out an inevitable loss in ranked just so you can report someone, so they can get a warning. That makes no sense at all. I know you guys are working on a new client, and i'd like to know if something like this will be implemented, because it's about 5 seasons overdue. 

This was not the only player I found doing this either, I still continue to run into players with "positive" attitudes, and just feed lanes throughout the game intentionally. And there's nothing you can do about it. I'm sure riot is aware, but it's such a simple fix they still haven't implied, and I'd like to understand their thought process. 

I apologize if this sounds like a rant, but these types of players need to be punished, and there's absolutely nothing other players can do about it right now.

replies.body:
If you have evidence of toxic behavior that you cannot report via the usual methods you can submit a support ticket.

Include their username in the ticket, as well as any screenshots or video you may have.

Tribunal isn't even active at this time. Reports are being handled by Riot staff.

Just report and move on, take a 5-10 minute break to not get in que with them and chill.

Nothing is instant, and it will be awhile before anyone will be banned.

if this person is trully negative, they wll get their day on the ban wagon.

till then stay strong, be patient.

i wouldn't hold your breath for the new tribunal system.

>Tribunal isn't even active at this time. Reports are being handled by Riot staff.

Source?
The new automated system is referred to as tribunal.

Guess what people like less than getting told the truth in a not-nice way?

Getting told irrelevant information.

Such as trivial names.

This post will get removed btw, since you "named and shamed." Reality of the matter is that riot should search ALL pregame chats even if the game was canceled. Then allow the old Tribunal system to punish these players. 3-5% of the community would get banned overnight. It would be precious.

Thank you for that I was unaware, I've removed his name. Also, I think you're completely correct, that said, I also still think it needs to be easier to report players, so that people can be deterred from such behavior, BEFORE they exhibit it.

We wont be getting a new Tribunal until the LCU is live. They have already stated they want to improve the Tribunal since the old system was faulty and caused for IP farming and false bans. 

What we have now is not the Tribunal, but the Instant Feedback system. Mostly handled by an automated system as well as Riot Support staff members. It is still referred to as the Tribunal, but it is not the Tribunal so to speak. 

Pregame is something Riot is interested in, since there is no report button at the beginning or during a match. But obviously, this wont come until the LCU is live since trying to change the client now could cause a whole bunch of issues. 

Remember, this is mostly a client issue, not a game issue. So making changes isn't as easy as game balancing or inserting a new champ/skin. But I understand what you're saying. Pregame flaming is an issue, and currently there are only two means of reporting it: playing the game and reporting at the end, or taking a screen shot and submitting it via Riot Support. Not entirely effective, but Riot has mentioned they want to look into better ways of improving the Tribunal and improving reports. 

Pregame is still recorded, but as I said you can't really report it unless you play the entire game to report or just screen shot and submit it manually. At least for now. Who knows what the updated Tribunal for the LCU will give us.

Hope that helps.

a lot of people have asked for a report button in the pre-game so they can dodge and still report.  unfortunately trolls are not stupid.  

if you add a report to the pregame they will just wait until the game starts to troll.  wouldnt you rather know before the game starts so you can dodge?

you would choose a temporary fix and make things worse in the long run

keep in mind most of these people would only get a chat restriction.  then they would think "oh i cant do that in pregame anymore".  and now you dont know you have a troll until the game starts
Wouldn't you love to recreate 1984 and let Big Brother dictate our every move?

there are much more sophisticated ways to game the system.

pre/post game chat is not one of them. Alot of people just think that it can't be caught, they are just misinformed.

If you play out the game though he is going to be punished because pre-game chat is part of what gets reported. Only if you dodge and don't go through with the game he gets away. Not saying that it's right just saying what happens in the current system. You can put pre-game chat in description.
